equivalent.description: $R$ is an equivalence relation on set $S$ if it is reflexive, symmetric, and transitive.
equivalent.question: Which of the following is an equivalence relation?

eqclass.description: An equivalence relation can be used to partition a set into equivalence classes. If two elements $a$ and $b$ are equivalent to each other, we write $a \equiv b$.
eqclass.question: Why is $=$  an equivalence relation?

mod.description: For the set of integers, the modulus function defines a binary relation such that two numbers $x$ and $y$ are in the relation if and only if $x \bmod m = y \bmod m$
mod.question: [T/F] For $m = 4$, the pair $\langle 1, 5\rangle$ belongs to the modulus relation.

partorder.description: A binary relation is called a partial order if it is antisymmetric and transitive.
partorder.question: Which of the following relations defines a partial order?
